items.content_html: "DocuComp is a lightweight and user-friendly tool designed to streamline the management of technical documentation and compliance tasks for developers. With DocuComp, you can efficiently organize, access, and collaborate on documentation, ensuring accuracy and compliance with regulatory requirements.
items.title: Devjosef/DocuComp: "DocuComp is a lightweight and user-friendly tool designed to streamline the management of technical documentation and compliance tasks for developers. With DocuComp, you can efficiently organize, access, and collaborate on documentation, ensuring accuracy and compliance with regulatory requirements.

items.content_html: **ToDo Application** A lightweight ToDo application built with Node.js. This app allows users to create, read, update, and delete tasks, ensuring efficient task management. Featuring a simple interface and real-time updates, it uses MongoDB for persistent data storage. Perfect for improving productivity and keeping track of daily tasks.
items.title: thomas7272/ToDoApplication: **ToDo Application**  A lightweight ToDo application built with Node.js. This app allows users to create, read, update, and delete tasks, ensuring efficient task management. Featuring a simple interface and real-time updates, it uses MongoDB for persistent data storage. Perfect for improving productivity and keeping track of daily tasks.

items.content_html: 🏠 A feature-rich but lightweight, buildroot-based Linux operating system alternative for your CloudFree CCU3/ELV-Charly 'homematicIP CCU' IoT smarthome central. Running as a pure virtual appliance (ProxmoxVE, Home Assistant, LXC, Docker/OCI, Kubernetes/K8s, etc.) or on a dedicated embedded device (RaspberryPi, Tinkerboard, IntelNUC, etc.)
items.title: jens-maus/RaspberryMatic: :house: A feature-rich but lightweight, buildroot-based Linux operating system alternative for your CloudFree CCU3/ELV-Charly 'homematicIP CCU' IoT smarthome central. Running as a pure virtual appliance (ProxmoxVE, Home Assistant, LXC, Docker/OCI, Kubernetes/K8s, etc.) or on a dedicated embedded device (RaspberryPi, Tinkerboard, IntelNUC, etc.)
